text: well I think that the taking of Crimea
by Russia was a foregone conclusion
there's nothing that the Western nations
could have done to prevent Putin from
moving his military forces into Crimea
because the Russians have always
considered the Crimea was part of Russia
when I was president even before that
and and I think about three-fourths of
the Crimean people consider themselves
to be part of Russia so that was no way
to change that but I think now we have
the same situation that I faced when I
was in in the White House and Christmas
week as a matter of fact of 1979 when
the Soviets invaded Afghanistan I took
very strong action I withdrew my
ambassador broke diplomatic relations
with Russia I declared an embargo
against Russia as well I began to arm
the freedom fighters in Afghanistan so
they could repel the Russian invaders
and I announced the Brezhnev that if he
went any further than he had already
gone that I would respond militarily
with all the weapons that we had at our
disposal
